summary: Worker.create fails when activities is set to undefined, throwing MODULE_NOT_FOUND error instead of handling the undefined value gracefully. The SDK should either accept undefined activities or provide a clear error message.
userImpact: Users cannot create workers with undefined activities parameter, preventing flexible worker initialization patterns.
rootCause: The Worker.create method attempts to load activities module even when activities parameter is explicitly set to undefined, causing MODULE_NOT_FOUND error.
workaround: Provide an activities object instead of leaving it undefined, or omit the activities parameter entirely.
resolutionDetails: SDK was updated to handle undefined activities parameter gracefully without attempting module resolution.
keyQuote: Worker.create with workDir and activities undefined does not work...it failed because of activities MODULE_NOT_FOUND
